qas.question: What kind of deficiency is common from taking 100-300mg of zinc daily?
What kind of complications were seen in men taking 80mg zinc a day?
Having an excess of 500ppm of zinc in soil interferes with what?

answers.text: ability of plants to absorb other essential metals

qas.question: What is caused by inhaling freshly formed zinc oxide?
People have claimed that the excessive use of what common product has caused disability and death?
What kind of deficiency is common from taking 1000-3000mg of zinc daily?
What kind of superpowers were seen in men taking 80mg zinc a day?

plausible_answers.text: ability of plants to absorb other essential metals

qas.question: Having an excess of 500ppm of zinc in soil helps with what?
What is caused by inhaling freshly formed zinc hydroxide?
What have people claimed excessive use of caused psychic powers?

context: There is evidence of induced <a0_0><b5_0>copper<b5_0/><a0_0/> deficiency in those taking 100–300 mg of zinc daily. A 2007 trial observed that elderly men taking 80 mg daily were hospitalized for <a1_0><b6_0>urinary<b6_0/><a1_0/> complications more often than those taking a placebo. The USDA RDA is 11 and 8 mg Zn/day for men and women, respectively. Levels of 100–300 mg may interfere with the utilization of copper and iron or adversely affect cholesterol. Levels of zinc in excess of 500 ppm in soil interfere with the <a2_0><b7_0>ability of plants to absorb other essential metals<b7_0/><a2_0/>, such as iron and manganese. There is also a condition called the <a3_0><b8_0>zinc shakes or "zinc chills"<b8_0/><a3_0/> that can be induced by the inhalation of freshly formed zinc oxide formed during the welding of galvanized materials. Zinc is a common ingredient of <a4_0><b9_0>denture cream<b9_0/><a4_0/> which may contain between 17 and 38 mg of zinc per gram. There have been claims of disability, and even death, due to excessive use of these products.
